docs.lead_paragraph: Echocardiograms, ultrasound pictures of the heart, are an enticing revenue stream for hospitals and physicians because they are painless and have no side effects.

headline.main: The Odd Math of Medical Tests: One Scan, Two Prices, Both High
headline.print_headline: The Odd Math of Medical Tests: One Scan, Two Prices, Both High

docs.abstract: Medical tests in United States health care system have become opportunities to bring in revenue, particularly because equipment used to perform them has largely become cheaper, smaller and more highly mechanized; wide pricing disparities have results because tests have been uncoupled from actual cost of business (Series: Paying Till It Hurts).
docs.snippet: Echocardiograms, ultrasound pictures of the heart, are an enticing revenue stream for hospitals and physicians because they are painless and have no side effects.

byline.contributor: Makiko Inoue contributed reporting from Tokyo.

docs.lead_paragraph: Even if the economy keeps growing, prosperity could continue to elude many Americans, given forces predating the Great Recession that are depressing wage growth and widening income inequality.

headline.main: Good Economic News, but Democrats Differ on Whether to Take Credit
headline.print_headline: Good Economic News, but Democrats Differ on Whether to Take Credit

docs.abstract: Washington Memo; Democrats are split on whether to take credit for latest series of good economic news; many in party want to take middle road between claiming progress and acknowledging lingering weakness; many economists say even if economy continues to grow, many Americans will not prosper.
docs.snippet: Even if the economy keeps growing, prosperity could continue to elude many Americans, given forces predating the Great Recession that are depressing wage growth and widening income inequality.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Bill Haslam proposed using federal funds to cover 200,000 low-income residents through their employer’s health insurance plan or the state’s Medicaid program.

headline.main: With Hospitals Under Stress, Tennessee’s Governor Pursues Medicaid Expansion
headline.print_headline: With Hospitals Under Stress, Tennessee’s Governor Pursues Medicaid Expansion

docs.abstract: Tennessee Gov Bill Haslam proposes using federal Medicaid money to cover 200,000 low-income residents through their employer's health insurance plan or state's Medicaid program; move comes after increasing pressure from financially stressed hospitals.
docs.snippet: Gov. Bill Haslam proposed using federal funds to cover 200,000 low-income residents through their employer’s health insurance plan or the state’s Medicaid program.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tennessee Governor Bill Haslam will call a special session of the state Legislature to consider a plan aimed at providing healthcare coverage to state residents who either do not have insurance or whose options are limited, he said on Monday.

headline.main: Tennessee Governor Proposes Alternative Plan to Obamacare
headline.print_headline: Tennessee Governor Proposes Alternative Plan to Obamacare

docs.snippet: Tennessee Governor Bill Haslam will call a special session of the state Legislature to consider a plan aimed at providing healthcare coverage to state residents who either do not have insurance or whose options are limited, he said on Monday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Senate was expected this week to renew dozens of temporary tax breaks, known as the "extenders," including big ones for business research, wind power and foreign profits.

headline.main: Tax Extenders Expected to Win U.S. Senate Approval Within Days
headline.print_headline: Tax Extenders Expected to Win U.S. Senate Approval Within Days

docs.abstract: The lame-duck Senate gets back to business on Monday and is set to begin approving the executive and judicial branch nominations.
docs.snippet: The lame-duck Senate gets back to business on Monday and is set to begin approving the executive and judicial branch nominations.

docs.lead_paragraph: With my scalding experience with my bronze policy fresh in my mind, I spent 10 days trying to choose health plans for my employees. This is a double decision: First, choose which insurance company to patronize and then which plans to offer. I’m going to walk you through my experience, so that you can compare what happened to me with your own situation — and maybe make use of some of my tactics.

headline.main: One Business Owner’s Journey to a Health Insurance Plan

docs.abstract: Last year, Paul Downs found that by shopping around instead of renewing an existing policy, he was able to save almost $30,000 on the company’s share of health premiums. Could he repeat that performance this year?
docs.snippet: Last year, Paul Downs found that by shopping around instead of renewing an existing policy, he was able to save almost $30,000 on the company’s share of health premiums. Could he repeat that performance this year?
